thread.title: A Guy Totaled A $300,000 Ferrari To Impress The Chick He’s Driving With And It Was Lovingly Caught On Video
thread.title_full: A Guy Totaled A $300,000 Ferrari To Impress The Chick He’s Driving With And It Was Lovingly Caught On Video

author: Chris Spags
title: A Guy Totaled A $300,000 Ferrari To Impress The Chick He’s Driving With And It Was Lovingly Caught On Video
text:
A Guy Totaled A $300,000 Ferrari To Impress The Chick He’s Driving With And It Was Lovingly Caught On Video Chris Spags | Email 
(accident is at 1:40 if you want to skip but some of the pre-crash chat is worth a listen) 
Jalopnik – This has pretty much everything: a $300,000 car, a 26-year-old driver used to driving his WRX STi, a poor speed:skill ratio, a passenger with more sense than the driver yelling uselessly to a wall of misplaced driving ego, and, of course, an unforgiving guardrail. 
From comments from this Reddit post from a guy who was there, on that same Colorado road, it seems like the driver overcooked the corner, entering it the 30 mph corner at about 90 mph, went hard on the brakes instead of steering, and understeered the Ferrari into the guard rail. 
Luckily, nobody was injured, and at least the driver had the decency to check on his friend before starting his well-deserved freakout. 
Rough for this dude. I don’t know how these exotic car tours turn out but hopefully he had all his waivers in order because the Reddit thread Jalopnik referenced says his insurance estimated about $270,000 worth of damage to the car . And it probably goes without saying but that’s a st p price to pay for a guy almost sending a high-priced sports car flying off a mountain because he’s trying to show off for the Bart Simpson-voiced gal in the car with him. But overall that’s a lesson that guys like this need to learn. A Ferrari like this goes well beyond being some gearhead dude who knows a little about cars and can fake his way through a conversation with people who know things with only some eye rolls. You’re dealing with some serious technology here that could send you soaring off a cliff like Thelma and Louise and hurt yourself and others on the road, it’s not a place to be a tough dude thinking he can hang corners at 90 miles an hour. Sometimes in life you’re a Mario Kart 50CC guy. No shame in that. 
Also love car hardo burns: 
Note: He is referring to a type of Subaru car and not a sexually transmitted infection. Now we don’t both have to Google that. Chris Spags |
